ray.rage.scene

Interface SkyBox

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable, Managed<SceneManager>, Nameable, SceneObject, Visible
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericSkyBox

    public interface SkyBox
extends SceneObject
    A sky box is a textured cube that simulates the presence of a sky, ground, and horizon in a scene.

    Sky boxes are meant to be unreachable by players, so it's the client's responsibility to make sure this is the case. This can be done in many different ways, such as making sure the sky box and camera scene-nodes are always at the same location in world-space.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  SkyBox.Face
      The faces of a sky-box are the "sides" onto which textures get mapped.

      • setTexture

        void setTexture(Texture tex,
                SkyBox.Face face)
        Sets the specified texture onto the specified face.
        Parameters:
        tex - The texture.
        face - The face.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.

      • getTexture

        Texture getTexture(SkyBox.Face face)
        Gets the texture currently on the specified face, if any.
        Parameters:
        face - The face to get the texture from.
        Returns:
        The texture, if any. Otherwise null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the face is null.
